title: Australian Safeguards and Non-proliferation Office
text:
The Australian Safeguards and Non-proliferation Office (ASNO) was established by the <a href="Australian%20Government">Australian Government</a> to enhance <a href="national%20security">national</a> and <a href="international%20security">international security</a> by contributing to "effective regimes against the proliferation of <a href="weapons%20of%20mass%20destruction">weapons of mass destruction</a>." It combines three <a href="Commonwealth%20of%20Nations">Commonwealth</a> agencies: the Australian Safeguards Office (ASO), the <a href="Chemical%20Weapons%20Convention">Chemical Weapons Convention</a> Office (CWCO), and the Australian Comprehensive Test Ban Office (ACTBO).
ASNO's Director General is a statutory officer, and his staff are <a href="public%20servant">public servant</a>s employed by the <a href="Department%20of%20Foreign%20Affairs%20and%20Trade%20%28Australia%29">Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade</a> (DFAT). The Director General has reported directly to the <a href="Minister%20for%20Foreign%20Affairs%20%28Australia%29">Minister for Foreign Affairs</a> since 1994. As of 2014, Dr. Robert Floyd is ANSO's Director General.
